headline: Sean Hannity previews interview with Steve Bannon
subHeadline: Sean Hannity sits down with Steve Bannon, executive chairman of Breitbart News and former White House chief strategist

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Welcome back America. I'm Greg Gutfeld with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and a key cup is our hot tub, Dana Perino -- "The Five" at 5. What the hell, NFL?  They're kneeling. They're standing. They're locking arms. What's next, downward dog? Some players kneeled for the anthem in England, but stood for God Save the Queen, yeah, because the British Empire was so amazing it sent three millions Africans into slavery. The players stood for the most imperialist empire of all time. I am officially outraged. I now protest the protesters. See how easy that was? Some Redskins took a knee. So they're fine with what's on their helmet but not the flag. Maybe because this issue has only one extra ingredient: Trump. How about those Raiders? Their emblem is a pirate. I'm not sure, but I bet pirates weren't community organizers.  So kneeling is now a protest against racism. Others say it disrespects the flag. Others see it as a time to stretch their quads. That's LeSean McCoy, stretching during the anthem. He got 21 yards on 14 carries. So keep stretching, champ.  Now this all started with Colin. Nancy, can you help me with his last name?

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: Kaepernick doing what he did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Uh-huh, exactly. Colin took a knee. But let's not forget, he also wore socks with pigs dressed as cops on them. So don't blame Donald Trump for politicizing football. He didn't wear the socks or inject division into a game. Now you can disagree with him, but don't be shocked by him. You protest on the clock, a businessman is going to want to fire you. You run a restaurant and a waiter starts chanting, "meat is murder," you're going to fire him. That's how bosses think. Believe me, I know.   So you notice a trend here? What do the NFL, ESPN, the Emmys, the college campuses, the Democratic Party all had in common? They're all crippled by identity politics. This politics of separation replaces patriotism -- here, literally -- and wraps around your brain like a warm suffocating blanket, so goodbye football. Bow down to the new national pastime, identity politics. The worst team sport ever because we all lose. All right, Juan. How awesome is this? Now the anthem is the most exciting, important part of the game. I mean, that's kind of a net plus here.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, it was on the news all weekend. It was bigger news than any of the football, except for that guy who kicked the field goal at the end of the Eagles-Giants game and set a record.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I did that for you. I disagree with you about who introduced divisiveness here. I think Trump was being very and intentionally divisive, when he said this down in Alabama. I think he's thinking it's going to stir his supporters, and his supporters are on the other side of the black lives matter issue. You know he says, oh, I don't have any awareness this is a racial issue. I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think he offend and upsets every race, creed, or color. I mean, Paul Ryan is not black. John McCain is not black.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Robert Kraft is not black. Robert Kraft is his buddy. And Robert Kraft said.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go, so it's not a race issue. There you go. Thank you for proving my point, Juan. This is the end of the show. We'll back to 9:00.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kimberly, everybody seems to be taking a knee everywhere but church.

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes. Well, that's the thing. Look, I don't like to see this happen in sports and in the NFL. And, you know, people staying in the locker room, but I love the guy who came out. Let me tell you that was fantastic. So I think that the problem is the media has such an obsession with President Trump. They love him but they hate them and they love to hate him. You know, they want to keep this thing going. He's going to be himself. He's not going to go through some magic transformation because he became president. His personality, the way he is and focus as a businessman, that's where he comes from in his center is talking about that, what's practical. OK. Well, this is my business and this is what people are doing. This is what I would do. So he's giving, sort of, unsolicited advice. Does it have an impact? Sure. But is now people want to react and say, OK, we're not going to stand for the national anthem. We're not going to respect the country and the Patriots because we're actually now peeved -- we're peeved at Trump, and we're irritated that he told us that we should stand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse, you know what? President Trump did what Colin Kaepernick did. He raised awareness. He protested. He used his voice. By the way, his name is Alejandro Villanueva. Top selling jersey in the last 24 hours.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: That's right. Trump is not being divisive. The people that kneeled during the anthem, I consider that divisive. Trump is criticizing divisive behavior, and ripping people that kneel isn't racist. He spent the last week criticizing crooked Hillary. She's as white as you could see. The only time the left defense football is when people disrespect the country. For the years, the left -- before the controversy, you know, it's a bunch of hooligans. This is a bunch of knuckled draggers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're domestic violence abusers. You're taking men away from their wives on Sunday. The logos are racist. Now it's completely the opposite. Tim Tebow took a knee to pray. He was mocked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: These guys kneeled to trash the flag and they're celebrated as heroes. Now Trump got a little carried away, I think in Alabama when he use the phrase SOB. I don't think he'd use that word to their face. But, I do think he was expressing the view of the majority of the country. No one thinks these guys should be kneeling during the anthem. It's disrespectful. It's not your platform to do it. You can't do whatever you want at work. You have the right to do it, but the boss has a right to fire you. The time -- during the anthem, it's a time to honor the soldiers who died fighting for the flag, not a time to push your grievance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Dana, I'm OK with the protest. It's nonviolent. Nobody is getting hurt. But then you must be OK with the response.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: . because the response is part of the protest. The protest is meant to upset people. So when people get upset, how can you be surprised, how can you be mad? Donald Trump is essentially a viewer. He's a viewer who watches -- he's every guy at home going, why are they doing it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And increasingly a lot of women. I mean, that's one thing that's actually been impressive about the NFL in the past ten years, that they're marketing program has been about family. It's actually quite a conservative message, which is everyone should gather together. You should see like their marketing expertise when it comes to these jerseys. If you go and look at how many women are actually buying those jerseys, I bet it was pretty high. So they've actually diversified and done all these great things. And then, Kaepernick does his kneeling thing -- was it two years ago?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And no one does anything, right? So if you're wearing the uniform, I'm assuming that mean you're at work. If you're at work, are you allowed to do things that are against the rules of the organization? If we did that, we'd be fired. That has actually happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that -- the thing about divisiveness, I agree with Jesse. It started with Kaepernick wanting to make a protest. I understand -- absolutely, willing to do that. But what I think is amazing here is that I don't necessarily think Trump meant to do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, by the way, then all of a sudden.  Kim: I agree.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But, it actually helped solidify his base even more because people are like, you know want, heck yeah, this is exactly what I believe. But I would bet for all of those people that protested, that kneeled, I think -- was it 13 percent of players. OK, that means that 81 percent or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They didn't do it. OK, fine. But if you were to ask all of them, why are you protesting? So it started with Kaepernick complaining that white officers were being let off for having killed black children in the line of duty. And he's mad about that. So he protests about that. Now, if you were to ask, why are you protesting? Well, I'm protesting because he called my mother -- he insulted my mother when he said SOB. I'm protesting because he insulted the franchise. It was about him. It was about them. So basically, now the protest is completely watered down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Actually now if you're protesting the flag, you're protesting Donald Trump, which I think it's a win for Donald Trump.  Kim: Exactly, inflating the issue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Inflating a great word. Shall we go to Donald Trump? I think his saying something below a helicopter or near one.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: I think it's very disrespectful to our flag and to our country, so I certainly think the owners should do something about it. There was great solidarity. I watched a little bit and I will say that there was tremendous solidarity for our flag and for our country. This has nothing to do with race. I've never said anything about race. This has nothing to do with race or anything else. This has to do with respect for our country and respect for our flag.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kimberly, this is quite a contrast. People see the flag and they go, symbol of oppression. He sees the flag and he says this represents the courage of the country. Can we reconcile this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah, and service to the country. We can even reconcile. They'll be no problem. So yes, he see it as service to the country, patriotism. And you know what -- I didn't just wake up one morning and say, OK, I'm the president and I've got an opinion. He has an opinion. He's giving it. He's entitled to it. The people that are upset with him now I guess they're kneeling because they're upset. They don't support, you know, President Trump. I don't know. Again, let's talk about coming together as a country and about what unites us that makes this country so special, and accepting an open and inviting to so many people from all over the world that have made families here and careers and established, you know, for generations to be able to live and thrive here. So this is the wealthy, strong, powerful country, a loyal country that can help others in times of need like we've seen. That's the kind of country that I think we should be focusing on. And people are just letting -- they're kind of like -- I think their own inner insecure or upset about the ideology overshadow the purpose of the anthem, and that to me is sad that it's getting lost and sort of misused in this fashion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know who was divisive? And I come to this, it's Donald Trump. I don't think there's any question. I think the NFL owners said quite clearly the reason they stood on the field with the players, right, is because they said we are not going to allow ourselves to be divided by President Trump, who is using it as a political football, the NFL. I mean, there's no question when you look at the history of sports, right now, the teams that get on the field for the anthem until recently. I think at some time in the early 2000's

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They used to play the anthem. Then you saw the military starts to buy events. They paid -- I thought that teams -- like my team, the Washington football team just put on this military display. Now they were being paid. The military sought this out very purposefully.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's part of their marketing budget because they were looking to try to find people who would want to join the armed forces.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Correct. And also just to build this whole sense of patriotism up. They're the ones that conflate it. And the final point -- the key point to me is that what Colin Kaepernick did -- and by the way, Colin Kaepernick's jersey is the top selling, generally, jersey in the country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Social justice warriors out there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And this guy for the Steelers, guess what he said, I agree with Colin Kaepernick.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think the NFL completely mishandled it, as they mishandled deflate gate, concussions, and domestic violence. Right now you have the NFL finding players for trying to commemorate fallen officers with a decal in their cleat or 9/11 victims. But there's no sanction whatsoever for kneeling during the national anthem. It's crazy. The Steelers player, Villanueva, you brought that up. He's now being criticized by his own coach for standing with his hand over his heart during the national anthem.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Why, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because he was the only one who didn't do it as a member of the team.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, Jesse. Because they have a team -- it's like all of us got together and we made a decision.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sometimes the country comes before the team. He's a veteran who served in Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm all for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's not going to stand inside while everybody else.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The coach was not criticizing him for having a political stand. In fact, I think everybody would say hats off. This man served three tours. But the idea is the team made a decision, and even his teammates who love him said we thought we were all in this together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This guy is not a hero, but Kaepernick who is the only one who kneel is a hero? You can't have it both ways, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I can because Kaepernick, in fact, to many people is standing. You've got to go back and look.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How's Kaepernick standing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Standing on principles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We can continue this in the B-block because this story is not going away, much like us. We're here to stay at 5:00 PM. We're not doing that again. Nine is scary. It's too late.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You go, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Mean people on the street out there. All right, more on President Trump's feud with the National Football League. And later, Sean Hannity joins us on set. You've might heard of him. He hosts the Lou Dobbs tonight, I believe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Continuing now with President Trump's anthem outrage at the NFL. A lot of people have been chiming in on the controversy who have no idea what they're talking about. Here's one of them, Grey's Anatomy actor Jesse Williams.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This anthem thing is a scam. This is not actually part of football. It was invented in 2009 from the government paying the NFL to market military recruitment, to get more people to go off and fight wars to die. This has nothing to do with the NFL or an American pastime or tradition. This is to get boys and girls to go fly overseas and go kill people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So now it's completely gone off the rails with this whole protest thing. My theory is, is that the fans don't want these people kneeling. The audience doesn't want them kneeling. Ratings are down. The jersey of the guy that actually stood is the highest seller. Yet the media thinks this is a big loser for President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I just like that now everyone has to issue a statement.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Every analyst, every athlete, they're trying to steal our jobs. This is what we do at The Five. I don't need to hear an actor from General Hospital. Nobody watches that show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think its Grey's Anatomy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Grey's Anatomy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who's Grey?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Meredith Grey, she's like the main female character.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't care about her. I love it how patriotism today -- it only matters when it's dissent. But whey talk about their planes flying. They call it flag-waving. Bob Costas -- oh, that's his flag waving. But if you dissent, oh, that's patriotic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's a big disconnect, I think, between fans out there, like I was saying -- and it's only a few players that are really doing this. The owners are caving because they don't want to upset a few of their players. But people don't like this, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They don't. And I think what you're going to see is that this will trickle down to high school -- your college, high school, little league, and it will be like, well, my team stood and your team didn't. You imagine the parents of these teams? Civility hangs by a thread.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It does.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think that was one of the complaints about that President Trump could -- I think he could have done this a different way which is to say, can't wait for you to come to the White House and we can all be together. It's going to be great. And he wouldn't have the teams that say that they don't want to go. What amazing is that, this week we could have led with any number of stories, with Jared Kushner revelation about possibly using a private email account for government business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We're not doing that story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, we're not going to do that story because we have this story to do. You could do the thing about Trump's back candidate likely to lose the election tomorrow, the Obamacare repeal and replace failing once again. But instead, what President Trump is able to do is to flip this around, and so the story everyone is talking about is how he's on the side of the flag and the country against a few greedy billionaires and overpaid athletes. So therefore, somehow this guy keeps winning.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And we don't even think he did it on purpose. You think.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I agree with Dana. I think that it would came up. He's very spontaneous. He speaks exponentially. That's why the speech was over like an hour and 20 minutes, whatever it was. So because he's just talking, he's saying what he thinks, top of his head. He doubled down on it. He's not backing off on it. That's his opinion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, you know, like it or not, whether you agree with him or not, you know, he's authentic in that sense is that he tells you what he's thinking and how he's feeling, and that's fine. And his friends can disagree with him, like Bob Kraft. He's very close. President Trump called him like every day when his wife passed away. And he's friend with Tom Brady. But Tom Brady did appreciate this, he's a businessman, he's the highest payed player in the NFL.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're scared.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They don't love this because, you know what, ticket sales are way down, and the numbers, the ratings, all of it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah, they want to save their franchise.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know who wants this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: NASCAR. NASCAR wants no part of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tom Brandy doesn't want to be harassed on Twitter. He wants just to be popular.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: One thing that bothers me in this is people saying this is disrespectful to the flag. You know, I mean, I think we all honor the flag, but the fact of the matter is this is about a social protest, and people choosing their method of protest. These people are not burning the flag. They're not inciting violence. They're protesting -- very clearly, they're protesting how the police engage in brutal tactics.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cops are there. Protest the cops. Have the guts to go to the cops.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's not -- no, this is a mistake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You're generalizing about all cops. It's not all cops. It's bad cops.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: If you talk about who politicize football in America, you go back and you look at who wouldn't hire black players. And you look at Alabama, Mississippi, and Georgia, no black players. You look at pro football teams that -- oh, we're going to protect our heritage and tradition and that means no black players. That's part of the tradition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is that part of his protest, too? I want to be clear.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, it's not. But I just want to be clear, you say, oh, bringing politics into it. Why do you have to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There are cops there on the field. Why don't go in and have the guts to protest against them instead of the flag because they don't.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There are police officers on the field.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The cops standing on the field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Protecting the players.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah. So that means bad cops.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't see the irony in that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I just think, Juan, that kneeling for the anthem does not garner any sympathy for the cause these people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that why Stevie Wonder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's actually failing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You watch. This is going to blow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I am watching. And no one else is because the ratings are down. Sean Hannity joins The Five next. He has a big show to tell you about, brand-new time slot with a special guest who rarely does interviews. Sean, coming right up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: As you could see we've moved back to 5:00 PM. But make sure you are still watching at 9:00 PM Eastern because our good friend Sean Hannity is taking over that time slot, and he's right here to tell us what we can expect on his big show later. Welcome back to The Five, Sean.

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, THE SEAN HANNITY SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you. You hated being at 9:00.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I didn't hate it, and I tried not to complain. But the truth is I never got used to it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know the key word, I tried not to complain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I tried not to complain. And I never really got used to it. And I would prefer to go to bed, but I won't go to bed until after your show.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, there are a lot of people that said to me, I can't stay up and watch a show at 10:00, and I'm like, yes, you can. I mean, it's important.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Fox & Friends is happy. They said they're going to watch it, because -- says she used to doze off of like 10:30. It's the halfway mark, so.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, it's fine. When you really think about cable battles, wars, we lost three quarters of our primetime audience. And the fact that the channel -- I'm saying thanks to all those people out there, because they've been so supportive.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He was laughing. He's saying, who would have ever thought Hannity made it -- who ever thought he would be the last man standing?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. It's terrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was wrong. I admit it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You have to be nice to Sean. Before when you're with O'Reilly, you didn't have to be.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is the first time we've been on the set together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It wasn't allowed before.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is interesting. Yeah, arm wrestle, although he'd smoke you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good point. If there were like eight or nine serious crises that this company went through and one could have sunk any network, and it's a testament to the audience.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I think this system.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: There's loyalty.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: . that's been created, and loyalty, because one of these could have.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, I'll say this, one of the reasons -- and all of you that have been here from the beginning, I think you know that I've been the biggest champion fan of the show. And you guys used to ask me, why do you think -- I said this is a hit show. And I said there's such amazing chemistry. And the numbers you guys pulled from the -- from pretty much day one has been phenomenal and amazing, and almost unprecedented in a cable news. But with all that said, yeah -- I never would have thought I'm the bridge between the generations.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know what, it's like going back to the beginning because you're at 9:00, so many years ago. So to me, it feels really good. It's like going home again. And I'm sorry excited to watch tonight because you have a huge interview with the man who doesn't give interviews.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: . Steve Bannon. You're going to talk with him...

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He doesn't. I have interviews this week with four people that rarely give interviews. Four.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Can you give us a hint?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Come on.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What can we expect tonight?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, tonight is going to be really good. Obviously, we're talking about the same football issue you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, the NFL is going to have a make a decision. If they're not going to let the Dallas Cowboys put on their helmet in respect of The Five slain officers last year, and they're not going to let -- what was the name of the linebacker? Avery Williamson wanted to put "Never Forget" on the 9/11 -- on the 15th anniversary of 9/11. And then they're going to allow the players to take a knee. Either they allow it or they don't allow it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: To me, one of the things I love about sports is that we get out of the political world. It unites everybody, and we like to see the most talented, gifted -- why are you looking at me like that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because your guy -- your guy, Donald Trump, brings this into it and then you want to blame the players.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Blaming the players that took the knee, the players that aren't respecting those that fought, bled, died.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what? Most NFL players were not doing anything until Donald Trump called their...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now we can see who the real men are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You want to hear the hypocrisy? You resent people introducing politics into sports. Yet, you throw a football on your show. You introduce sports into politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Aha!

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I do introduce sports into politics. And you really want -- and everyone makes fun. The only reason it's a nerf football is because, when I use the real football...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You hurt people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: ... I have to pay for every broken light.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And these lights are expensive.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: They're not cheap.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Patriotic. Red, white and blue.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You should pay for throwing lessons.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Oooh!

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: I'm awake now. It's been six months.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You were playing tennis this weekend.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: I did. Very good.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And your shoulder hurt.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: My shoulder is better now, because...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I've got a rotator cuff, and I'm not letting somebody operate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Really? I thought that was the only way that you could get it healed, was to operate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's the only way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's why I throw -- I go a little sidearm.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: She's a good tennis player. You ought to see. I particularly like the coach.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You're going to talk to Bannon, and Bannon will be down in Alabama. And we've got a big Senate race there tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Big.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Big Senate race. Now, he is supporting Judge Moore, Roy Moore, right?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So am I.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The ayatollah of Alabama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ooh, wow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The ayatollah of Alabama?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what he is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Get out of here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The ayatollah is not a nice guy, Juan.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I find this show is so good, fair and balanced.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think -- but I'm thinking to myself, my man Sean is not going to buck the president. He's not going to buck Trump. But Trump is supporting big Luther.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: OK. I've already endorsed Roy Moore. And before that, I endorsed Mo Brooks. So frankly, Luther Strange is one for three. I'll tell you why I think it is. My anger is at Mitch McConnell right now. He's at an 18 percent approval rating in his own home state of Kentucky. And it's really simple. And it's when you make promises in life and you give your word, you show a sense of urgency. My biggest complaint about all of government, Republicans and Democrats, is they're not serving the 50 million Americans in poverty, on Food Stamps, out of the labor force, 51-year low home ownership rates. These are real Americans. They're really suffering, and government is failing them at a spectacular level. And maybe as somebody that's a conservative that votes more Republican, I expect more out of them. I know you're the party of "no." The Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The party of "no." I say -- oh, I forgot. I forgot who was the obstructionist party last eight years.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You're the party of "keep your doctor plan and save money." That party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I say something about that? Because I don't know a ton about that race. But so Roy Moore has said from the beginning that he was against the wall. He's recently backtracked on that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And he's been against the Graham-Cassidy bill to repeal and replace Obamacare. So wouldn't he be just as much a problem for President Trump as he is for Mitch McConnell?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I think the reason Mitch McConnell, last I read, I think it's about $3.5 million he's put in. Other -- what we call -- you and I have this discussion privately a lot -- establishment. I want people that really are jazzed and motivated and don't go on vacation. They have the best health care. They have barbershops. They have workout rooms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I get that, but I'm actually just curious about this one, this race in particular.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Barbershops?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You didn't hear about the Senate barbershops?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can't tell.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: At least you still need one.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Good point. You know, look, at the end of the day, I think we can do so much better for the American people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't disagree. I just -- I'm curious about this particular case, because he actually works against -- he says he was against it. I know he's changed his mind on the wall of late, but Luther Strange has actually been for it and for President Trump all along. But I think that's...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: As long as we have the agenda done, I'd be happy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And my -- it's funny. In 2014, I put out the Conservative Solution Caucus. And the solutions are simple. You balance your budget. You live within your means. You repeal and replace Obamacare. Health cooperatives, health savings accounts. You control your borders. You have a tough national defense. You know, we want every American -- I'm a dishwasher. I'm the guy at 12 washing dishes by hand. And I have had an opportunity to have the American dream work in my life at a spectacular level that I can tell you right now I never deserved. And I just want every single person to have the rung of the latter put in place, and government is an obstacle. And this is something we would agree on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think we would agree.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We want hope and opportunity for people, and they're not getting it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know that -- you're saying that somehow, because Luther Strange is coming in, he's just not going to knock the table over. And I think that's all he's going to do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I think Roy Moore is going to be more on the conservative side. He's going to be with the Ted Cruzes and probably challenging the leadership. And whether you like it or not, they had seven and a half years of...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait a second.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: ... telling us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Mitch is not a conservative anymore, because you're a Trump guy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Mitch hasn't gotten off his big fat duff and gone to work and rolled up his sleeves with urgency.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, they're both from Alabama, so how bad could they be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm for Luther Strange.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Can I just join in and be done at 6 p.m.?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, there you go. You've got to vote for Luther Strange. He has the best name ever. He sounds like -- no, he sounds like a villain. Dr. Luther Strange. He was, like, made radioactive. He was a veterinarian made radioactive by a mutant bunny.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And he's, like, seven feet tall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. What are you talking...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: His name, Luther Strange.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Once we get Kid Rock in the Senate, we'll be all set.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What about Bob Dylan?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Tell everybody what you said to me in the green room.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: About how much we love Hannity?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What did I say?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I'm taking eye drops because I have a problem with my eye. You go, "Can I see it? Is there anything good in there?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's what he does. He takes everybody's...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I always check everybody's medications.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. He helps with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What are you going to say when a Democrat wins that Alabama seat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nothing, because it won't happen.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It won't happen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, so on a personal -- on a personal note from "The Five," we do want to say thank you so much, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Because when this show first started, you were out there in the front, supporting us and really pushing and saying...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Promoting on the radio.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... special. When nobody believed in us, and this guy was like, "They've got it here." And...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I really mean this. I'm blessed to know all of you personally, except for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are we allowed to get along now?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I never said a word.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You never said a word. Please. You see me in the elevator. I'm not going to repeat what you said.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to repeat what you said. All right. I just want...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You and O'Reilly are friends now. You went on his show. But did he go on your show?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He was recently at my house.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That must've been fun.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It was fun, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He doesn't drink, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I'm trying to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "Here's my book. Here, you've got to read this. A best seller."

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Actually, I did read his book. It's really good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know. It's very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I hear you say some -- all right. That's all the time we have for him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Can I say something? I'm proud of everybody on the show. You guys have done so well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for you. Remember?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We love you guys. I love all you guys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He said you throw like a girl.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. See how much we love Sean Hannity? And I know you do, too. So don't forget to catch him at his brand-new time. It is going to be amazing, 9 p.m. Eastern tonight on the FOX News Channel. We are all going to be watching. Much more to come on "The Five." Stay right there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A declaration of war. That's how North Korea is interpreting President Trump's new tweet over the weekend that the country's leadership won't be around much longer. Kim Jong-un's foreign minister firing back and issuing very concerning new threats this morning.

utterances.speaker: RI YONG-HO, NORTH KOREAN FOREIGN MINISTER
utterances.sentences: This is clearly a declaration of war. Since the United States declared war on our country, we will have every right to make countermeasures, including the right to shoot down the United States strategic bombers even when they're not yet inside the airspace border of our country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The White House pushed strongly back on that earlier today.

utterances.speaker: SARAH HUCKABEE SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: We've not declared war on North Korea. And frankly, the suggestion of that is absurd. It's never appropriate for a country to shoot down another country's aircraft when it's over international waters.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So Jesse, what they're trying to do here is to say, like, "Just calm down. This is actually not a problem." But this is not -- this is not a season of "24." This is, like -- this is serious business.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Little Rocket Man is like most Washington politicians: he's all talk and no action. The guy's a great bluffer. He's not shooting down a B-1 bomber. He's not attacking Guam. He's not going to fire a missile at California. He's cagey, though, because he does just enough to keep up the threat and to consolidate his power domestically but not enough to invite an attack. The issue is every time he does detonate a bomb or launch a missile, his scientists gain enough knowledge to be able to ultimately create the capability to put a nuke on an ICBM, and then we're living under a nuclear blackmail situation. So that's the problem.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you think that Kim Jong-un is sort of asking for a preemptive strike by doing these sort of provocative things?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't get it. How can you have a declaration of war if we're already technically at war? We never stopped. It's like your ex, 15 years later, announcing that she's still dumping you. It's over. I get it, North Korea. We are not Facebook friends.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I can't relate to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Here's the good thing. Trump has an uncanny way of taking every existing problem and involving everyone. This is, in a way, like the NFL. Why is North Korea more bellicose than usual when the threat hasn't changed? Obama said the very same thing about us being able to destroy North Korea, but he said it in an academic kind of way. The difference is -- the difference is the progress. We have China and we have even the U.N., and we have Russia, to some extent, playing our game. That's new. So that's why North Korea is more bellicose. The threat of annihilation, Obama had mentioned before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I think...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's also the progress of the technology on the North Korean side, which is they're much farther along that we thought they would be.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. I mean, what worries me is the bullying talk, the kind of schoolyard talk. I don't think the idea that it's become so mano-a-mano between President Trump and the North Korean leader, because one, I don't think he deserves to have that stature. But two, all of a sudden, it becomes, like, "You're not going to show me up. But I got it better than you." This is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I've got to get Kimberly in here before we have to break, because we only have 30 seconds. Kimberly, your best thoughts.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Aren't they always, though? I try. Look at -- the situation is the president has an obligation to protect and defend the United States from enemies foreign and domestic. And certainly, North Korea has been more than provocative in terms of its threats, in terms of its conduct and its actions in furtherance of those threats. We have to take this seriously. I don't feel in any way that the president has declared, you know, this a war against North Korea. But at the same time, they have to be very careful, because I think they've push this all the way down to like, you know, first and goal for us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think the reason the North Korea response, because what he said at the U.N. suggested that maybe he would take preemptive action.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not going to -- I don't buy that at all, and I don't give them any pass whatsoever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And also, retaliation is not a war crime. OK. Please stay with us, because we're going to celebrate "The Five's" return to 5 p.m. with some of your creative videos and photos about how happy you are that we're back at 5. That's next. UNIDENTIFIED MALE (singing): Welcome back to 5. It was fun while it lasted till nine. Kimberly, Dana, Juan and Watters, and that "Gutfeld Show" guy arrived. Your interactions make this sound (oh), all the different ways you speak your mind. So keep the magic alive, and no matter what time, I'll be watching "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Nice!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was excellent. We really liked that. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Bravo! Bravo!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was one of our fabulous fans with a little ditty about our move back to 5 p.m. We asked you on Friday to tweet us videos or pictures to help celebrate. And we've gotten some great ones.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We'll be airing them all week, so keep sending them. Use the hashtag #WelcomeBackTo5.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Happy hour.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What did you say?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a picture of happy hour, I believe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Happy hour. Excellent. Kimberly, what do you think? People sending in videos like that. That was terrific.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I thought it was fantastic. I got some videos and pictures sent to me too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sorry about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, hey!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I had a little too much wine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Good to be back at 5, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You're creative.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I was never at 5, but I'm happy to be at 5.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Whoa! What is that picture?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, what is that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Is that somebody in bed?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know, we say "DVR 'The Five'."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, a unicorn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look at that. Unicorn cup.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And that has a horn, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's happy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: She is happy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's pretty amazing how many people in my...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There we go. Look at the Manhattan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is the whole point.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The people wanted "The Five" back at 5, because they drank.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because they wanted to start drinking at 5.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that the wine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what, though? I've run into people...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Look at Greg's face.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg's got a crush. Man crush Monday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I was going to say, people at the gym say that they watch while they're working out. Apparently, it's a big...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We love our work out. And the moms who are cooking dinner with their kids doing the homework.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, at my gym, they don't have FOX on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Al Jazeera.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness. Goodness gracious.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow, looks like -- is that Disney.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Pictures of Disneyland.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's people saying hi with the five. The five hand. They're pretty happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would say that my scientific survey says 98 percent of people are happy with our return to five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm just tired of getting. Don't email me or text me anymore or tweet me about...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Being back at 5? GUTFELD; ... being at 5 and complaining. Do not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think there's some people who think, "We used to watch you when it was 9 at night."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know what? Juan, DVR. DVR.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Or come. You know what? Switch over. You know the show now, and you know how much you like it. So watch at 5. We're great. We're great at any hour.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's right, we are. We are great at any hour.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So you know what?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The show that keeps on giving.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's my point. We're going to keep celebrating, Kimberly...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: ... next week, and we're going to play your song choices as bump-in music.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So send -- yes you are, Gregory.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're included.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. Not doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Keep sending them using the hashtag #WelcomeBackTo5.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" is next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why not?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Shocking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing." Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So yesterday, I was in Washington, D.C., at a charity event. It was a Full-Court Press on ALS event. There I am with Michael Onrichs (ph), who's a friend of mine. ALS is Lou Gehrig's disease. Remember, that's why everybody was dumping buckets of water over their head. Now we know what that's about. I was given an award there for some of my work. It was actually kind of like a wrestling belt. If you can see it right there. Kind of an unorthodox thing. I'm holding it up like a champion. And if you guys want to donate to Full-Court Press on ALS, they have a GoFundMe page. Full- Court Press on ALS.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And are they making progress?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Making progress day by day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Terrific. That's great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Good job, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are -- you are a nice person.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He cares a lot about that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Despite what people say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Despite what your family says.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Cheap shot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: One thing is, you thought I was getting to go to bed early tonight, and I'm not. For this week, I'm the host. It's called "FOX News Tonight" for one week only at 10 p.m. So please join us tonight. Ben Shapiro will be on tonight. It will be fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's a good "get."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The other -- well, my "One More Thing" is that country is coming to "American Idol." Because you know, that is the most important music genre that we have. It was announced today that Luke Bryan will be named as a judge on "American Idol." It's going to air next march on ABC. The reason I'm doing this is that last week when I did my "One More Thing"...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You cut him out of the photo!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did, but not only that, we spelled his name wrong. So lovely young producer, new to country music but she's learning. She said "Luke Brian," and I've been embarrassed ever since. So we apologize. And congrats on "American Idol."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. Enough. No one cares. Glad we fired that producer. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Everyone cares about this. Time for "Kimberly's Royal News." All right. Oh, no. Oh my -- all right, fine. Prince Harry and his girlfriend, American actress Meghan Markle, made their first public appearance together today. Now, the young royal couple held hands and sat together at a wheelchair tennis game in Toronto. As you know, Prince Harry is visiting over there for the Invictus games for wounded veterans. And he founded the Paralympic-style competition to raise awareness about the challenges that wounded service members face and allow them to compete internationally against other soldiers. Fantastic cause. I'm very excited for them. And I look forward to many more segments like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Time for something...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Looking good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: ... less inspirational.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate these people!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Last week I did six different airplanes in three days, and one thing that kept popping up. Young people with giant bedroom pillows. They look like they're going to a slumber party, but they're going on a plane. And they have their giant -- it's a bedroom pillow. No, no. Leave that at home.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A neck pillow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's not a neck pillow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They've got to get the neck pillow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They've got to get the neck pillow. It looks very silly. You don't impress anybody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You don't have any pictures of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. I would never photograph that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wow, you mailed that in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, no early fall break for Chelsea Manning. The Canadian government won't let her into the country. Yes, Thursday morning she was blocked from entering Canada on grounds of serious criminality. The offense she was convicted of -- this is according to the Canadians -- would equate to an indictable offense, namely treason, if committed in Canada. So Manning says she's going to challenge the decision. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says he's going to look into the case.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Set your DVRs. Never mitch [SIC] -- miss an episode of "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Mitch!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Special Report" up next. Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2017 CQ-Roll Call, Inc. All materials herein are protected by United States copyright law and may not be reproduced, distributed, transmitted, displayed, published or broadcast without the prior written permission of CQ-Roll Call. You may not alter or remove any trademark, copyright or other notice from copies of the content.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Welcome back America. I'm Greg Gutfeld with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and a key cup is our hot tub, Dana Perino -- "The Five" at 5. What the hell, NFL? They're kneeling. They're standing. They're locking arms. What's next, downward dog? Some players kneeled for the anthem in England, but stood for God Save the Queen, yeah, because the British Empire was so amazing it sent three millions Africans into slavery. The players stood for the most imperialist empire of all time. I am officially outraged. I now protest the protesters. See how easy that was? Some Redskins took a knee. So they're fine with what's on their helmet but not the flag. Maybe because this issue has only one extra ingredient: Trump. How about those Raiders? Their emblem is a pirate. I'm not sure, but I bet pirates weren't community organizers. So kneeling is now a protest against racism. Others say it disrespects the flag. Others see it as a time to stretch their quads. That's LeSean McCoy, stretching during the anthem. He got 21 yards on 14 carries. So keep stretching, champ. Now this all started with Colin. Nancy, can you help me with his last name?

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: Kaepernick doing what he did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-huh, exactly. Colin took a knee. But let's not forget, he also wore socks with pigs dressed as cops on them. So don't blame Donald Trump for politicizing football. He didn't wear the socks or inject division into a game. Now you can disagree with him, but don't be shocked by him. You protest on the clock, a businessman is going to want to fire you. You run a restaurant and a waiter starts chanting, "meat is murder," you're going to fire him. That's how bosses think. Believe me, I know. So you notice a trend here? What do the NFL, ESPN, the Emmys, the college campuses, the Democratic Party all had in common? They're all crippled by identity politics. This politics of separation replaces patriotism -- here, literally -- and wraps around your brain like a warm suffocating blanket, so goodbye football. Bow down to the new national pastime, identity politics. The worst team sport ever because we all lose. All right, Juan. How awesome is this? Now the anthem is the most exciting, important part of the game. I mean, that's kind of a net plus here.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, it was on the news all weekend. It was bigger news than any of the football, except for that guy who kicked the field goal at the end of the Eagles-Giants game and set a record.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I did that for you. I disagree with you about who introduced divisiveness here. I think Trump was being very and intentionally divisive, when he said this down in Alabama. I think he's thinking it's going to stir his supporters, and his supporters are on the other side of the black lives matter issue. You know he says, oh, I don't have any awareness this is a racial issue. I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think he offend and upsets every race, creed, or color. I mean, Paul Ryan is not black. John McCain is not black.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Robert Kraft is not black. Robert Kraft is his buddy. And Robert Kraft said.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go, so it's not a race issue. There you go. Thank you for proving my point, Juan. This is the end of the show. We'll back to 9:00.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, everybody seems to be taking a knee everywhere but church.

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, that's the thing. Look, I don't like to see this happen in sports and in the NFL. And, you know, people staying in the locker room, but I love the guy who came out. Let me tell you that was fantastic. So I think that the problem is the media has such an obsession with President Trump. They love him but they hate them and they love to hate him. You know, they want to keep this thing going. He's going to be himself. He's not going to go through some magic transformation because he became president. His personality, the way he is and focus as a businessman, that's where he comes from in his center is talking about that, what's practical. OK. Well, this is my business and this is what people are doing. This is what I would do. So he's giving, sort of, unsolicited advice. Does it have an impact? Sure. But is now people want to react and say, OK, we're not going to stand for the national anthem. We're not going to respect the country and the Patriots because we're actually now peeved -- we're peeved at Trump, and we're irritated that he told us that we should stand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse, you know what? President Trump did what Colin Kaepernick did. He raised awareness. He protested. He used his voice. By the way, his name is Alejandro Villanueva. Top selling jersey in the last 24 hours.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: That's right. Trump is not being divisive. The people that kneeled during the anthem, I consider that divisive. Trump is criticizing divisive behavior, and ripping people that kneel isn't racist. He spent the last week criticizing crooked Hillary. She's as white as you could see. The only time the left defense football is when people disrespect the country. For the years, the left -- before the controversy, you know, it's a bunch of hooligans. This is a bunch of knuckled draggers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're domestic violence abusers. You're taking men away from their wives on Sunday. The logos are racist. Now it's completely the opposite. Tim Tebow took a knee to pray. He was mocked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: These guys kneeled to trash the flag and they're celebrated as heroes. Now Trump got a little carried away, I think in Alabama when he use the phrase SOB. I don't think he'd use that word to their face. But, I do think he was expressing the view of the majority of the country. No one thinks these guys should be kneeling during the anthem. It's disrespectful. It's not your platform to do it. You can't do whatever you want at work. You have the right to do it, but the boss has a right to fire you. The time -- during the anthem, it's a time to honor the soldiers who died fighting for the flag, not a time to push your grievance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Dana, I'm OK with the protest. It's nonviolent. Nobody is getting hurt. But then you must be OK with the response.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: . because the response is part of the protest. The protest is meant to upset people. So when people get upset, how can you be surprised, how can you be mad? Donald Trump is essentially a viewer. He's a viewer who watches -- he's every guy at home going, why are they doing it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And increasingly a lot of women. I mean, that's one thing that's actually been impressive about the NFL in the past ten years, that they're marketing program has been about family. It's actually quite a conservative message, which is everyone should gather together. You should see like their marketing expertise when it comes to these jerseys. If you go and look at how many women are actually buying those jerseys, I bet it was pretty high. So they've actually diversified and done all these great things. And then, Kaepernick does his kneeling thing -- was it two years ago?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And no one does anything, right? So if you're wearing the uniform, I'm assuming that mean you're at work. If you're at work, are you allowed to do things that are against the rules of the organization? If we did that, we'd be fired. That has actually happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that -- the thing about divisiveness, I agree with Jesse. It started with Kaepernick wanting to make a protest. I understand -- absolutely, willing to do that. But what I think is amazing here is that I don't necessarily think Trump meant to do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, by the way, then all of a sudden.

utterances.speaker: Kim
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But, it actually helped solidify his base even more because people are like, you know want, heck yeah, this is exactly what I believe. But I would bet for all of those people that protested, that kneeled, I think -- was it 13 percent of players. OK, that means that 81 percent or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They didn't do it. OK, fine. But if you were to ask all of them, why are you protesting? So it started with Kaepernick complaining that white officers were being let off for having killed black children in the line of duty. And he's mad about that. So he protests about that. Now, if you were to ask, why are you protesting? Well, I'm protesting because he called my mother -- he insulted my mother when he said SOB. I'm protesting because he insulted the franchise. It was about him. It was about them. So basically, now the protest is completely watered down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. Actually now if you're protesting the flag, you're protesting Donald Trump, which I think it's a win for Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: Kim
utterances.utterance: Exactly, inflating the issue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Inflating a great word. Shall we go to Donald Trump? I think his saying something below a helicopter or near one.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: I think it's very disrespectful to our flag and to our country, so I certainly think the owners should do something about it. There was great solidarity. I watched a little bit and I will say that there was tremendous solidarity for our flag and for our country. This has nothing to do with race. I've never said anything about race. This has nothing to do with race or anything else. This has to do with respect for our country and respect for our flag.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, this is quite a contrast. People see the flag and they go, symbol of oppression. He sees the flag and he says this represents the courage of the country. Can we reconcile this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, and service to the country. We can even reconcile. They'll be no problem. So yes, he see it as service to the country, patriotism. And you know what -- I didn't just wake up one morning and say, OK, I'm the president and I've got an opinion. He has an opinion. He's giving it. He's entitled to it. The people that are upset with him now I guess they're kneeling because they're upset. They don't support, you know, President Trump. I don't know. Again, let's talk about coming together as a country and about what unites us that makes this country so special, and accepting an open and inviting to so many people from all over the world that have made families here and careers and established, you know, for generations to be able to live and thrive here. So this is the wealthy, strong, powerful country, a loyal country that can help others in times of need like we've seen. That's the kind of country that I think we should be focusing on. And people are just letting -- they're kind of like -- I think their own inner insecure or upset about the ideology overshadow the purpose of the anthem, and that to me is sad that it's getting lost and sort of misused in this fashion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know who was divisive? And I come to this, it's Donald Trump. I don't think there's any question. I think the NFL owners said quite clearly the reason they stood on the field with the players, right, is because they said we are not going to allow ourselves to be divided by President Trump, who is using it as a political football, the NFL. I mean, there's no question when you look at the history of sports, right now, the teams that get on the field for the anthem until recently. I think at some time in the early 2000's

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They used to play the anthem. Then you saw the military starts to buy events. They paid -- I thought that teams -- like my team, the Washington football team just put on this military display. Now they were being paid. The military sought this out very purposefully.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's part of their marketing budget because they were looking to try to find people who would want to join the armed forces.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct. And also just to build this whole sense of patriotism up. They're the ones that conflate it. And the final point -- the key point to me is that what Colin Kaepernick did -- and by the way, Colin Kaepernick's jersey is the top selling, generally, jersey in the country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Social justice warriors out there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And this guy for the Steelers, guess what he said, I agree with Colin Kaepernick.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think the NFL completely mishandled it, as they mishandled deflate gate, concussions, and domestic violence. Right now you have the NFL finding players for trying to commemorate fallen officers with a decal in their cleat or 9/11 victims. But there's no sanction whatsoever for kneeling during the national anthem. It's crazy. The Steelers player, Villanueva, you brought that up. He's now being criticized by his own coach for standing with his hand over his heart during the national anthem.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Why, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because he was the only one who didn't do it as a member of the team.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, Jesse. Because they have a team -- it's like all of us got together and we made a decision.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sometimes the country comes before the team. He's a veteran who served in Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm all for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's not going to stand inside while everybody else.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm just saying, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The coach was not criticizing him for having a political stand. In fact, I think everybody would say hats off. This man served three tours. But the idea is the team made a decision, and even his teammates who love him said we thought we were all in this together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This guy is not a hero, but Kaepernick who is the only one who kneel is a hero? You can't have it both ways, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I can because Kaepernick, in fact, to many people is standing. You've got to go back and look.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How's Kaepernick standing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Standing on principles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We can continue this in the B-block because this story is not going away, much like us. We're here to stay at 5:00 PM. We're not doing that again. Nine is scary. It's too late.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You go, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mean people on the street out there. All right, more on President Trump's feud with the National Football League. And later, Sean Hannity joins us on set. You've might heard of him. He hosts the Lou Dobbs tonight, I believe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Continuing now with President Trump's anthem outrage at the NFL. A lot of people have been chiming in on the controversy who have no idea what they're talking about. Here's one of them, Grey's Anatomy actor Jesse Williams.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This anthem thing is a scam. This is not actually part of football. It was invented in 2009 from the government paying the NFL to market military recruitment, to get more people to go off and fight wars to die. This has nothing to do with the NFL or an American pastime or tradition. This is to get boys and girls to go fly overseas and go kill people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
