utterances.utterance: So now it's completely gone off the rails with this whole protest thing. My theory is, is that the fans don't want these people kneeling. The audience doesn't want them kneeling. Ratings are down. The jersey of the guy that actually stood is the highest seller. Yet the media thinks this is a big loser for President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just like that now everyone has to issue a statement.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every analyst, every athlete, they're trying to steal our jobs. This is what we do at The Five. I don't need to hear an actor from General Hospital. Nobody watches that show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think its Grey's Anatomy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Grey's Anatomy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who's Grey?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Meredith Grey, she's like the main female character.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't care about her. I love it how patriotism today -- it only matters when it's dissent. But whey talk about their planes flying. They call it flag-waving. Bob Costas -- oh, that's his flag waving. But if you dissent, oh, that's patriotic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's a big disconnect, I think, between fans out there, like I was saying -- and it's only a few players that are really doing this. The owners are caving because they don't want to upset a few of their players. But people don't like this, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They don't. And I think what you're going to see is that this will trickle down to high school -- your college, high school, little league, and it will be like, well, my team stood and your team didn't. You imagine the parents of these teams? Civility hangs by a thread.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It does.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I think that was one of the complaints about that President Trump could -- I think he could have done this a different way which is to say, can't wait for you to come to the White House and we can all be together. It's going to be great. And he wouldn't have the teams that say that they don't want to go. What amazing is that, this week we could have led with any number of stories, with Jared Kushner revelation about possibly using a private email account for government business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're not doing that story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, we're not going to do that story because we have this story to do. You could do the thing about Trump's back candidate likely to lose the election tomorrow, the Obamacare repeal and replace failing once again. But instead, what President Trump is able to do is to flip this around, and so the story everyone is talking about is how he's on the side of the flag and the country against a few greedy billionaires and overpaid athletes. So therefore, somehow this guy keeps winning.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And we don't even think he did it on purpose. You think.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I agree with Dana. I think that it would came up. He's very spontaneous. He speaks exponentially. That's why the speech was over like an hour and 20 minutes, whatever it was. So because he's just talking, he's saying what he thinks, top of his head. He doubled down on it. He's not backing off on it. That's his opinion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So, you know, like it or not, whether you agree with him or not, you know, he's authentic in that sense is that he tells you what he's thinking and how he's feeling, and that's fine. And his friends can disagree with him, like Bob Kraft. He's very close. President Trump called him like every day when his wife passed away. And he's friend with Tom Brady. But Tom Brady did appreciate this, he's a businessman, he's the highest payed player in the NFL.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're scared.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They don't love this because, you know what, ticket sales are way down, and the numbers, the ratings, all of it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah, they want to save their franchise.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You know who wants this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: NASCAR. NASCAR wants no part of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tom Brandy doesn't want to be harassed on Twitter. He wants just to be popular.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: One thing that bothers me in this is people saying this is disrespectful to the flag. You know, I mean, I think we all honor the flag, but the fact of the matter is this is about a social protest, and people choosing their method of protest. These people are not burning the flag. They're not inciting violence. They're protesting -- very clearly, they're protesting how the police engage in brutal tactics.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cops are there. Protest the cops. Have the guts to go to the cops.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not -- no, this is a mistake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're generalizing about all cops. It's not all cops. It's bad cops.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If you talk about who politicize football in America, you go back and you look at who wouldn't hire black players. And you look at Alabama, Mississippi, and Georgia, no black players. You look at pro football teams that -- oh, we're going to protect our heritage and tradition and that means no black players. That's part of the tradition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is that part of his protest, too? I want to be clear.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it's not. But I just want to be clear, you say, oh, bringing politics into it. Why do you have to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There are cops there on the field. Why don't go in and have the guts to protest against them instead of the flag because they don't.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There are police officers on the field.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The cops standing on the field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Protecting the players.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. So that means bad cops.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't see the irony in that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just think, Juan, that kneeling for the anthem does not garner any sympathy for the cause these people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that why Stevie Wonder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's actually failing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You watch. This is going to blow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I am watching. And no one else is because the ratings are down. Sean Hannity joins The Five next. He has a big show to tell you about, brand-new time slot with a special guest who rarely does interviews. Sean, coming right up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: As you could see we've moved back to 5:00 PM. But make sure you are still watching at 9:00 PM Eastern because our good friend Sean Hannity is taking over that time slot, and he's right here to tell us what we can expect on his big show later. Welcome back to The Five, Sean.

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, THE SEAN HANNITY SHOW HOST
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you. You hated being at 9:00.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I didn't hate it, and I tried not to complain. But the truth is I never got used to it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know the key word, I tried not to complain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I tried not to complain. And I never really got used to it. And I would prefer to go to bed, but I won't go to bed until after your show.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, there are a lot of people that said to me, I can't stay up and watch a show at 10:00, and I'm like, yes, you can. I mean, it's important.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fox & Friends is happy. They said they're going to watch it, because -- says she used to doze off of like 10:30. It's the halfway mark, so.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, it's fine. When you really think about cable battles, wars, we lost three quarters of our primetime audience. And the fact that the channel -- I'm saying thanks to all those people out there, because they've been so supportive.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He was laughing. He's saying, who would have ever thought Hannity made it -- who ever thought he would be the last man standing?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. It's terrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was wrong. I admit it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to be nice to Sean. Before when you're with O'Reilly, you didn't have to be.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is the first time we've been on the set together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It wasn't allowed before.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: This is interesting. Yeah, arm wrestle, although he'd smoke you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good point. If there were like eight or nine serious crises that this company went through and one could have sunk any network, and it's a testament to the audience.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And I think this system.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: There's loyalty.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: . that's been created, and loyalty, because one of these could have.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, I'll say this, one of the reasons -- and all of you that have been here from the beginning, I think you know that I've been the biggest champion fan of the show. And you guys used to ask me, why do you think -- I said this is a hit show. And I said there's such amazing chemistry. And the numbers you guys pulled from the -- from pretty much day one has been phenomenal and amazing, and almost unprecedented in a cable news. But with all that said, yeah -- I never would have thought I'm the bridge between the generations.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You know what, it's like going back to the beginning because you're at 9:00, so many years ago. So to me, it feels really good. It's like going home again. And I'm sorry excited to watch tonight because you have a huge interview with the man who doesn't give interviews.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: . Steve Bannon. You're going to talk with him...

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He doesn't. I have interviews this week with four people that rarely give interviews. Four.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can you give us a hint?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Come on.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What can we expect tonight?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, tonight is going to be really good. Obviously, we're talking about the same football issue you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, the NFL is going to have a make a decision. If they're not going to let the Dallas Cowboys put on their helmet in respect of The Five slain officers last year, and they're not going to let -- what was the name of the linebacker? Avery Williamson wanted to put "Never Forget" on the 9/11 -- on the 15th anniversary of 9/11. And then they're going to allow the players to take a knee. Either they allow it or they don't allow it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: To me, one of the things I love about sports is that we get out of the political world. It unites everybody, and we like to see the most talented, gifted -- why are you looking at me like that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because your guy -- your guy, Donald Trump, brings this into it and then you want to blame the players.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Blaming the players that took the knee, the players that aren't respecting those that fought, bled, died.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what? Most NFL players were not doing anything until Donald Trump called their...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Now we can see who the real men are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You want to hear the hypocrisy? You resent people introducing politics into sports. Yet, you throw a football on your show. You introduce sports into politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Aha!

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I do introduce sports into politics. And you really want -- and everyone makes fun. The only reason it's a nerf football is because, when I use the real football...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You hurt people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: ... I have to pay for every broken light.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And these lights are expensive.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: They're not cheap.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Patriotic. Red, white and blue.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You should pay for throwing lessons.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oooh!

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.utterance: I'm awake now. It's been six months.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You were playing tennis this weekend.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.utterance: I did. Very good.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And your shoulder hurt.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.utterance: My shoulder is better now, because...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I've got a rotator cuff, and I'm not letting somebody operate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Really? I thought that was the only way that you could get it healed, was to operate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's the only way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's why I throw -- I go a little sidearm.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She's a good tennis player. You ought to see. I particularly like the coach.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're going to talk to Bannon, and Bannon will be down in Alabama. And we've got a big Senate race there tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Big.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Big Senate race. Now, he is supporting Judge Moore, Roy Moore, right?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So am I.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The ayatollah of Alabama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ooh, wow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The ayatollah of Alabama?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what he is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Get out of here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The ayatollah is not a nice guy, Juan.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I find this show is so good, fair and balanced.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think -- but I'm thinking to myself, my man Sean is not going to buck the president. He's not going to buck Trump. But Trump is supporting big Luther.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. I've already endorsed Roy Moore. And before that, I endorsed Mo Brooks. So frankly, Luther Strange is one for three. I'll tell you why I think it is. My anger is at Mitch McConnell right now. He's at an 18 percent approval rating in his own home state of Kentucky. And it's really simple. And it's when you make promises in life and you give your word, you show a sense of urgency. My biggest complaint about all of government, Republicans and Democrats, is they're not serving the 50 million Americans in poverty, on Food Stamps, out of the labor force, 51-year low home ownership rates. These are real Americans. They're really suffering, and government is failing them at a spectacular level. And maybe as somebody that's a conservative that votes more Republican, I expect more out of them. I know you're the party of "no." The Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The party of "no." I say -- oh, I forgot. I forgot who was the obstructionist party last eight years.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're the party of "keep your doctor plan and save money." That party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I say something about that? Because I don't know a ton about that race. But so Roy Moore has said from the beginning that he was against the wall. He's recently backtracked on that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he's been against the Graham-Cassidy bill to repeal and replace Obamacare. So wouldn't he be just as much a problem for President Trump as he is for Mitch McConnell?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think the reason Mitch McConnell, last I read, I think it's about $3.5 million he's put in. Other -- what we call -- you and I have this discussion privately a lot -- establishment. I want people that really are jazzed and motivated and don't go on vacation. They have the best health care. They have barbershops. They have workout rooms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I get that, but I'm actually just curious about this one, this race in particular.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Barbershops?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You didn't hear about the Senate barbershops?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't tell.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: At least you still need one.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Good point. You know, look, at the end of the day, I think we can do so much better for the American people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't disagree. I just -- I'm curious about this particular case, because he actually works against -- he says he was against it. I know he's changed his mind on the wall of late, but Luther Strange has actually been for it and for President Trump all along. But I think that's...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: As long as we have the agenda done, I'd be happy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And my -- it's funny. In 2014, I put out the Conservative Solution Caucus. And the solutions are simple. You balance your budget. You live within your means. You repeal and replace Obamacare. Health cooperatives, health savings accounts. You control your borders. You have a tough national defense. You know, we want every American -- I'm a dishwasher. I'm the guy at 12 washing dishes by hand. And I have had an opportunity to have the American dream work in my life at a spectacular level that I can tell you right now I never deserved. And I just want every single person to have the rung of the latter put in place, and government is an obstacle. And this is something we would agree on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think we would agree.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We want hope and opportunity for people, and they're not getting it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know that -- you're saying that somehow, because Luther Strange is coming in, he's just not going to knock the table over. And I think that's all he's going to do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think Roy Moore is going to be more on the conservative side. He's going to be with the Ted Cruzes and probably challenging the leadership. And whether you like it or not, they had seven and a half years of...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: ... telling us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So Mitch is not a conservative anymore, because you're a Trump guy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mitch hasn't gotten off his big fat duff and gone to work and rolled up his sleeves with urgency.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, they're both from Alabama, so how bad could they be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm for Luther Strange.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Can I just join in and be done at 6 p.m.?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there you go. You've got to vote for Luther Strange. He has the best name ever. He sounds like -- no, he sounds like a villain. Dr. Luther Strange. He was, like, made radioactive. He was a veterinarian made radioactive by a mutant bunny.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he's, like, seven feet tall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. What are you talking...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: His name, Luther Strange.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Once we get Kid Rock in the Senate, we'll be all set.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What about Bob Dylan?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Tell everybody what you said to me in the green room.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: About how much we love Hannity?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What did I say?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm taking eye drops because I have a problem with my eye. You go, "Can I see it? Is there anything good in there?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what he does. He takes everybody's...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I always check everybody's medications.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. He helps with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What are you going to say when a Democrat wins that Alabama seat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nothing, because it won't happen.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It won't happen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, so on a personal -- on a personal note from "The Five," we do want to say thank you so much, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because when this show first started, you were out there in the front, supporting us and really pushing and saying...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Promoting on the radio.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: ... special. When nobody believed in us, and this guy was like, "They've got it here." And...

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I really mean this. I'm blessed to know all of you personally, except for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are we allowed to get along now?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I never said a word.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You never said a word. Please. You see me in the elevator. I'm not going to repeat what you said.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to repeat what you said. All right. I just want...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You and O'Reilly are friends now. You went on his show. But did he go on your show?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He was recently at my house.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That must've been fun.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It was fun, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He doesn't drink, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm trying to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Here's my book. Here, you've got to read this. A best seller."

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Actually, I did read his book. It's really good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. It's very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I hear you say some -- all right. That's all the time we have for him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Can I say something? I'm proud of everybody on the show. You guys have done so well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for you. Remember?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We love you guys. I love all you guys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He said you throw like a girl.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. See how much we love Sean Hannity? And I know you do, too. So don't forget to catch him at his brand-new time. It is going to be amazing, 9 p.m. Eastern tonight on the FOX News Channel. We are all going to be watching. Much more to come on "The Five." Stay right there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A declaration of war. That's how North Korea is interpreting President Trump's new tweet over the weekend that the country's leadership won't be around much longer. Kim Jong-un's foreign minister firing back and issuing very concerning new threats this morning.

utterances.speaker: RI YONG-HO, NORTH KOREAN FOREIGN MINISTER
utterances.utterance: This is clearly a declaration of war. Since the United States declared war on our country, we will have every right to make countermeasures, including the right to shoot down the United States strategic bombers even when they're not yet inside the airspace border of our country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The White House pushed strongly back on that earlier today.

utterances.speaker: SARAH HUCKABEE SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: We've not declared war on North Korea. And frankly, the suggestion of that is absurd. It's never appropriate for a country to shoot down another country's aircraft when it's over international waters.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So Jesse, what they're trying to do here is to say, like, "Just calm down. This is actually not a problem." But this is not -- this is not a season of "24." This is, like -- this is serious business.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Little Rocket Man is like most Washington politicians: he's all talk and no action. The guy's a great bluffer. He's not shooting down a B-1 bomber. He's not attacking Guam. He's not going to fire a missile at California. He's cagey, though, because he does just enough to keep up the threat and to consolidate his power domestically but not enough to invite an attack. The issue is every time he does detonate a bomb or launch a missile, his scientists gain enough knowledge to be able to ultimately create the capability to put a nuke on an ICBM, and then we're living under a nuclear blackmail situation. So that's the problem.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you think that Kim Jong-un is sort of asking for a preemptive strike by doing these sort of provocative things?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't get it. How can you have a declaration of war if we're already technically at war? We never stopped. It's like your ex, 15 years later, announcing that she's still dumping you. It's over. I get it, North Korea. We are not Facebook friends.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can't relate to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here's the good thing. Trump has an uncanny way of taking every existing problem and involving everyone. This is, in a way, like the NFL. Why is North Korea more bellicose than usual when the threat hasn't changed? Obama said the very same thing about us being able to destroy North Korea, but he said it in an academic kind of way. The difference is -- the difference is the progress. We have China and we have even the U.N., and we have Russia, to some extent, playing our game. That's new. So that's why North Korea is more bellicose. The threat of annihilation, Obama had mentioned before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I think...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's also the progress of the technology on the North Korean side, which is they're much farther along that we thought they would be.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. I mean, what worries me is the bullying talk, the kind of schoolyard talk. I don't think the idea that it's become so mano-a-mano between President Trump and the North Korean leader, because one, I don't think he deserves to have that stature. But two, all of a sudden, it becomes, like, "You're not going to show me up. But I got it better than you." This is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've got to get Kimberly in here before we have to break, because we only have 30 seconds. Kimberly, your best thoughts.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Aren't they always, though? I try. Look at -- the situation is the president has an obligation to protect and defend the United States from enemies foreign and domestic. And certainly, North Korea has been more than provocative in terms of its threats, in terms of its conduct and its actions in furtherance of those threats. We have to take this seriously. I don't feel in any way that the president has declared, you know, this a war against North Korea. But at the same time, they have to be very careful, because I think they've push this all the way down to like, you know, first and goal for us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think the reason the North Korea response, because what he said at the U.N. suggested that maybe he would take preemptive action.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, I'm not going to -- I don't buy that at all, and I don't give them any pass whatsoever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And also, retaliation is not a war crime. OK. Please stay with us, because we're going to celebrate "The Five's" return to 5 p.m. with some of your creative videos and photos about how happy you are that we're back at 5. That's next.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE (singing)
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to 5. It was fun while it lasted till nine. Kimberly, Dana, Juan and Watters, and that "Gutfeld Show" guy arrived. Your interactions make this sound (oh), all the different ways you speak your mind. So keep the magic alive, and no matter what time, I'll be watching "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Nice!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That was excellent. We really liked that. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Bravo! Bravo!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That was one of our fabulous fans with a little ditty about our move back to 5 p.m. We asked you on Friday to tweet us videos or pictures to help celebrate. And we've gotten some great ones.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We'll be airing them all week, so keep sending them. Use the hashtag #WelcomeBackTo5.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Happy hour.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What did you say?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a picture of happy hour, I believe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Happy hour. Excellent. Kimberly, what do you think? People sending in videos like that. That was terrific.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, I thought it was fantastic. I got some videos and pictures sent to me too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sorry about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey, hey!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I had a little too much wine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Good to be back at 5, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're creative.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I was never at 5, but I'm happy to be at 5.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Whoa! What is that picture?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, what is that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Is that somebody in bed?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, we say "DVR 'The Five'."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, a unicorn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look at that. Unicorn cup.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And that has a horn, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She's happy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: She is happy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's pretty amazing how many people in my...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There we go. Look at the Manhattan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is the whole point.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The people wanted "The Five" back at 5, because they drank.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because they wanted to start drinking at 5.

It was actually kind of like a wrestling belt. If you can see it right there. Kind of an unorthodox thing. I'm holding it up like a champion. And if you guys want to donate to Full-Court Press on ALS, they have a GoFundMe page. Full- Court Press on ALS.

utterances.utterance: All right, all right. Enough. No one cares. Glad we fired that producer. Kimberly.

Prince Harry and his girlfriend, American actress Meghan Markle, made their first public appearance together today. And he founded the Paralympic-style competition to raise awareness about the challenges that wounded service members face and allow them to compete internationally against other soldiers. Fantastic cause. I'm very excited for them. And I look forward to many more segments like this.
